column4: How do I set it so that network shares and mounted devices do not get shown on my desktop?
or just click a checkbox in gconf-editor
because gnome only checks for mounted drives in /media .. I think it's hardcoded somewhere
not sure what the rationale behind it is though.. someone thought it was a good idea?
you can mount network drives whereever you want.. just put them in your fstab.. it's only the point'n'click way that puts them in /media
but sure.. you can do it "find" or some other bash stuff as well
